item.title: #TIL : Internal Variables in BASH
item.description: Internal Variables in BASH $PWD Your current working directory, so you don’t have to use CWD=$(pwd)

item.title: #TIL : BASH tracing commands
item.description: BASH tracing commands Thank Hiro Ishii for teaching me this set -x will print all running commands in your bash script

item.title: #TIL : BASH exiting on first error
item.description: BASH exiting on first error Setting a flag set -e to bash script will let the script exit on first error occurs, so if you want to ignore a command just adding || true to suffix

item.title: #TIL : BASH return a value in function
item.description: BASH return a value in function Creating function is a good way to refactor your bash script.

item.title: #TIL : Using BSD find util to find and exec command on file and folder
item.description: Using BSD find util to find and exec command on file and folder Simple syntax of find

item.title: #TIL : wget Output flag
item.description: wget Output flag -O means output $ # output file will be index.html or based on header filename $ wget -O www.

item.title: #TIL : Bash shell shortcuts
item.description: Bash shell shortcuts Ctrl + e : jump cursor to EOL Ctrl + a : jump cursor to BOL (beginning of line) Ctrl + u : delete all from cursor to BOL Ctrl + k : delete all from cursor to EOL Ctrl + r : search history, press again for next search Ctrl + l : clear shell screen Ctrl + c : terminate the command (sometimes have to press twice) Ctrl + z : suspend the command, back to shell.
